review_title: In theory great but behind closed doors…
pros: The mission and desire for students is great!
cons: -Low pay for amount of work (especially on salary) and can cause burn out - White savior leadership vibe - Zero movement upwards in job promotion - clear favoritism and tolerance for inappropriate behaviors by managers

review_title: You'll Be Squeezed for All Your Worth
pros: -Mission is fantastic! -Everyone is inspired to support students -There is an opportunity for growth in just about every position
cons: -Low pay for an extreme level of work (if you're on a salary, this is especially true) -Racist microaggressions (especially if you're a facilitator, you're a token POC) - No work-life balance (expect to get burnt out)

pros:
In this role, you will become an expert at facilitation.
You will be exposed to all different kinds of people through the work you do in schools.
You will truly have a direct impact on the lives of students and teachers.
You will get to be creative, silly, and independent.
You will be welcomed to a group of people who believe what you believe, and you'll get lots of opportunities to travel and interact with the arts, nature, and our community in a new way.
Summer can be very chill.
cons:
You will absolutely get burned out.
You may feel isolated when working directly with students all day and then returning to the office; not many who don't have this specific role understand the demands of it.
There is not a clear path for upward mobility from the entry level positions.

review_title: Care about kids, care about employees
pros: They really put their mission of 'Kids First' front and center. The ED really cares about the mission and the staff.
cons: It can be hard work, and sometimes we have to sacrifice for the students.

job_title: Director of Operations in Kabale, Kabale
pros: Being a NGO it was my desire to work for the project to help the need children
Rewarding to work with young people
good pay, laid back environment , serving others
cons: no medical benefits, long hours, lots of information to process, lots of training

review_title: Great place to work, PS is committed to their employees.
pros:
Great co-workers
Great reputation in the community
Opportunities to grow within the company
cons: Youth work is difficult, always learning and growing but that is a plus too, depending on how you look at it!

review_title: Awesome Place for Youth Development Work
pros: Work Culture was great. All of the different opportunities for youth that were made available are fantastic. There were professional development opportunities for staff as well.
cons: Pay was a little on the low end, but the benefits package was great. There was a  fair amount of gift compensation, which is a motivator, but higher pay would have been preferable.

pros: Strong mission and values. Organization has a great caring, compassionate, and momentous environment. Working with young people is inspiring. Org is growing and hoping to deepen impact
cons: Oops for upward mobility feel limited. Vision is sometimes vague. Burnout potential is a by high

pros: Friendly work environment, fast paced, incredible professionalism
